snippet: When Mary Meeker landed her first job as an analyst at Salomon Brothers in 1986, she didn't plan to stick around.     ''I wanted to work as a sell-side analyst for two years and then go manage money,'' she said in an interview on Monday. ''The sto...
abstract: Susanne Craig Dealbook column; Mary Meeker is leaving Morgan Stanley to join venture capital firm Keiner Perkins Caufield & Byers as partner; Meeker, once referred to as Queen of the Net for bullish stock calls during Internet bubble, will focus on advising and finding Internet-related investment opportunities; photo (M)

headline.main: 'Queen of the Net' Trades Stock Picks for Tech Entrepreneurs

snippet: Rick Maiman/Bloomberg NewsRaj Rajaratnam, Galleon Group's founder, has been accused of earning money from stock trades made with inside information.On Wall Street, it is called the ''mosaic theory.''     Every day, professional investors and resea...
abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin Dealbook Column analyzes legality of investor 'mosaics', small pieces of researched data about companies that is gathered and woven together by consultants and sold to hedge funds in order to give them competitive edge; says mosaics are being scrutinized by federal authorities as part of widening investigation into securities fraud; notes Raj Rajaratnam, currently under investigation for fraud, has argued that mosaics do not constitute insider information; photo (M)
